meanings.definition: A lease of a property by a tenant to a subtenant.
meanings.sent1: The sublease agreement allowed the subtenant to occupy the apartment.
meanings.sent2: She signed a sublease to rent out her extra room to a friend.
meanings.sent3: The sublease arrangement turned the apartment into a bustling shared space.
meanings.sent4: His sublease on the office space was like passing the torch of responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The sublease transformed the empty room into a cozy home for someone else.

meanings.definition: To lease or rent all or part of a leased property.
meanings.sent1: They decided to sublease the office space to reduce costs.
meanings.sent2: He subleased his parking spot to a neighbor for a small fee.
meanings.sent3: Subleasing the storage unit felt like a smart financial move.
meanings.sent4: She subleased the storefront, opening up new opportunities for others.
meanings.sent5: Subleasing the land allowed them to share the benefits with another business.
